metadata.feature_description: Filter activity stream by various criteria and activity types

steps.action: Navigate to Community page and locate the filter dropdown
steps.expected: Filter dropdown should be visible with activity type options
steps.actual: Filter dropdown visible with 'Filter by activity' default text and many activity type options

steps.expected: Filter should be applied and only badge activities should be shown
steps.actual: Filter applied successfully, dropdown shows 'Badge' selected

steps.action: Verify filtered results show only badge activities
steps.expected: Activity stream should display only badge-related activities
steps.actual: Activity stream shows badge activities - 'Test User11 received the badge Getting started' visible

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Filter by activity type (Added to Wiki)

steps.action: Select 'Added to Wiki' from the filter dropdown
steps.expected: Filter should be applied and only wiki article activities should be shown
steps.actual: Filter applied successfully, activity stream shows only wiki article activities

steps.action: Reset filter to default 'Filter by activity' option
steps.expected: All activities should be displayed without any filter
steps.actual: Filter reset successfully, all activities visible including wiki articles, posts, and badge activities

steps.action: Click 'Create New Feed' link in the Activity Stream Filter section
steps.expected: Custom Feed Builder dialog should open
steps.actual: Custom Feed Builder dialog opened with Feed Name field, Activity Authors, Activity Groups, and activity type checkboxes

steps.action: Enter 'Wiki Activity Filter' as the name and select 'Added to Wiki' activity type
steps.expected: Form should accept the input and checkbox should be selected
steps.actual: Feed name entered and 'Added to Wiki' checkbox selected with checkmark visible

steps.action: Click Save button to save the custom filter
steps.expected: Filter should be saved and appear in the Activity Stream Filter section
steps.actual: Filter saved successfully and 'Wiki Activity Filter' appears in the sidebar under Activity Stream Filter section

steps.action: Click on the saved 'Wiki Activity Filter' in the sidebar
steps.expected: The saved filter should be applied and only wiki activities should be displayed
steps.actual: Custom filter applied successfully, activity stream shows only wiki-related activities (authored wiki article entries)

steps.action: Click the edit icon next to the saved filter
steps.expected: Custom Feed Builder dialog should open in edit mode with existing settings pre-populated
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened showing Feed Name 'Wiki Activity Filter', 'Added to Wiki' checkbox checked, and Cancel/Delete/Update buttons

steps.action: Click the Delete button in the edit dialog
steps.expected: Filter should be deleted and removed from the Activity Stream Filter section
steps.actual: Filter deleted successfully, 'Wiki Activity Filter' no longer appears in the Activity Stream Filter section, only 'Create New Feed' link remains

steps.action: Create a new filter named 'Persistence Test Filter' with Blogs activity type selected
steps.actual: Filter saved successfully and appears in the Activity Stream Filter section

steps.action: Refresh the page to simulate a new session
steps.expected: Saved filter should persist and still be visible after page refresh
steps.actual: After page refresh, 'Persistence Test Filter' is still visible in the Activity Stream Filter section

observations: The activity stream filter dropdown provides 37 different activity types to filter by, including Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Blogs, Friends, Group Created, Group Joined, Added to Wiki, Updated Wiki, Added a Document, and many more
Custom filters support filtering by Authors, Groups, and multiple Activity Types simultaneously
The Custom Feed Builder dialog uses Knockout.js for data binding and provides a clean UI for filter creation
No date range filter was found in the UI - the filter functionality is based on activity types, authors, and groups only
No explicit 'Filter by user' dropdown was found - users can be filtered through the custom filter's Activity Authors field
No explicit 'Filter by group' dropdown was found - groups can be filtered through the custom filter's Activity Groups field
